question.Title: Why doesn't this code run in cmd but does in the python shell?
question.Body:
When running this code with the Python Shell from IDLE, it works perfectly: the message gets printed character by character

But when I put this code in a .py file and run it with the executable program py.exe, the only thing that happens is that a window pops up and closes itself, but nothing shows up in it.

I also tried to add at the end the line: time.sleep(5) but I still couldn't see the message printed.

import timemessage = 'Hello, welcome to the game...'for i in message:    print(i, end='')    time.sleep(0.04)
